libs.java.extension.collections.observable

Class NotificationSet<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • libs.java.extension.collections.observable.NotificationCollection<E>
      • libs.java.extension.collections.observable.NotificationSet<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<E>, java.util.Collection<E>, java.util.Set<E>

    public class NotificationSet<E>
extends NotificationCollection<E>
implements java.util.Set<E>
    Observable Set. Sample usage - Set a = new NotificationSet(new HashSet(),null, new NotificationListener() {
    Author:
    Kuldeep

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NotificationSet(java.util.Set<E> set)
      Constructor with underlying Set, no executor, so all notification will be part of set operation thread
      NotificationSet(java.util.Set<E> set, java.util.concurrent.Executor ex)
      Constructor with set and executor, all notification to listeners will be sent using this executor
      NotificationSet(java.util.Set<E> set, java.util.concurrent.Executor ex, NotificationListener<E> listener)
      Constructor with set, executor and listener.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(E e)
      Add element to the Set, and notifies listener for Add event.
      boolean addAll(java.util.Collection<? extends E> elements)
      Add elements to the set , and notifies listener for Add event NotifictionEventType = NotificationListener.NotificationEventType.ADD List#addAll(Collection)) Note - extra instructions
      void addListener(NotificationListener<E> listener)
      Add listener to the set.
      void clear()
      Clears set , and notifies listener event NotifictionEventType = NotificationListener.NotificationEventType.CLEAR See List.clear() Note - It iterates over collection to capture elements, so extra instruction, careful in performance apps
      boolean contains(java.lang.Object o) 
      boolean containsAll(java.util.Collection<?> c) 
      java.util.Set<E> getSet()
      returns underlying set
      boolean isEmpty() 
      java.util.Iterator<E> iterator()

      Removes and Return element and notifies listener for Delete event NotifictionEventType = NotificationListener.NotificationEventType.DELETE Set#remove(Object))
      boolean removeAll(java.util.Collection<?> elements)
      Removes given elements from set, and notifies listener for Delete Multi event NotifictionEventType = NotificationListener.NotificationEventType.DELETE Set#removeAll(Collection)) Note - Extra instructions to send notification, be careful in performance
      boolean removeListener(NotificationListener<E> listener)
      Removes listener to the set.
      boolean retainAll(java.util.Collection<?> elements)
      Removes all elements except in given elements, and notifies listener for Delete multi event NotifictionEventType = NotificationListener.NotificationEventType.DELETE Set#retainAll(Collection)) Note - Extra instructions to send notification, be careful in performance

      • NotificationSet

        public NotificationSet(java.util.Set<E> set,
                       java.util.concurrent.Executor ex,
                       NotificationListener<E> listener)
        Constructor with set, executor and listener. This is to simplify registration of listener in separate call (See addListener(NotificationListener). However more listener can be added, removed
        Parameters:
        set - underlying set
        ex - executor
        listener - listener for event
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if set is null

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears set , and notifies listener event NotifictionEventType = NotificationListener.NotificationEventType.CLEAR See List.clear() Note - It iterates over collection to capture elements, so extra instruction, careful in performance apps
